LocaleData.m_text: Are you sure you want to quit?\nAny unsaved progress will be lost.
A file with the same name already exists. Overwrite?
Too short a distance to the next intersection.
There is not enough space to build here.
The intersecting roads are at too tight an angle.
The slope of the road is too steep.
You don't have enough money to build.
The road is too long to build.
Cannot place a stop at this location.
There is no available route from the previous stop.
Tram track cannot be built at this location.
The line must start at a depot.
The previous stop is the same as this stop.
Line must end at same the depot where it begins.
There are not enough stops on the line.
The stop/depot does not support this vehicle type.
You cannot bulldoze objects owned by other companies.
Trolley wires cannot be built at this location.
Depot cannot be built at this location.
Ignore {0} of passengers waiting to enter
Efficient working time {0} minutes per hour
Cannot find a path to the next stop.
{0} wants to use normal time speed
{0} wants to use fast time speed
{0} wants to use very fast time speed
{0} was kicked out of the game
Take a screenshot of the scene
Take a screenshot of the scene with GUI
Modify the terrain on a large scale
Are you sure you want to quit the game?
Are you sure you want to delete the file?
That key cannot be assigned for this action.
Steam initialization failed!\n\nMake sure Steam client is running.
Press the key you want to assign, or ESC to erase
Rotate object with the mouse wheel, when a secondary action is pressed
Zoom camera with the mouse wheel
Network port to use when hosting:
Play tutorial when starting a new game
View the map and move around

That doesn't seem too hard. I'm sure we can get it done in no time! First you should familiarize yourself with the city. Have a look around to get the hang of things! Use W, A, S and D to {b}move around{/b}. You can rotate the mouse wheel to make the view {b}zoom{/b} in and out, or you can use Q and E keys. Holding down Z or the center mouse button lets you {b}rotate and tilt{/b} the camera freely. You can also rotate and tilt the camera with the arrow keys.

There's a lot more to a city than what you can see on the street level. To really get to know who is going where and what destinations are most popular, you can use the {b}Map Data{/b} tab. You can find this tab under the drawer icon in the lower right menu. Select "Buildings" and then "Blue collar" to display the typical {b}Blue collar locations{/b} on the map. By applying such filters to the map, you can see homes, places of work and leisure, and other locations important to each social group, all marked with different colors. The brighter the color, the more important the place. For example {b}bright green{/b} shows the buildings where the most blue collar workers live. {b}Bright red{/b} shows where they most often work.

Well done! Now the next step is to have a look at the tools you have at your disposal. To build a thriving transport system, you will need many different vehicle types. Go to the {b}Build panel{/b} to see what's available.

Choose the {b}Bus Tools{/b}, which can be found under the Construction menu by pressing the Bus Stop button. Later, there will be many different buildings that you can use, but right now we will use the most basic stop type. {b}Build a bus line{/b} now! Start by building the {b}Depot{/b} and placing the {b}Stops{/b}, and keep in mind that your line must start and end at the Depot. Try placing six stops and a Depot now!

Open the Transportation panel and {b}create a new bus line{/b}. Choose Add Stops, then begin with the Depot, and add the stops in the order you want the vehicle to visit them. The white circle around the stop indicates the {b}catchment area{/b}, meaning how far people are willing to walk to get to the stop. If you want your line to run quite often, you might wish to choose the first stop again at the end of the line. This way the vehicle will continue another circuit immediately, if the line needs it, skipping its stop by the Depot. {b}Close the line{/b} by guiding the bus back to the {b}Depot{/b}.

Next, click your bus depot and {b}buy three vehicles{/b}. You can see the estimated number of vehicles the line needs by checking the info page in the line window. Keep in mind that the Depot can only service a certain number of vehicles. You can have more stored there, but the mechanics won't have enough time to keep all in top condition. After you have purchased your vehicles, {b}the line will automatically start to run{/b} according to the timetable. You can adjust the timetables whenever you like. To {b}stop the line{/b} temporarily, click the small green circle icon next to the line in the Lines panel. The circle will turn to red, meaning the line has been stopped.

Looks like your line could do with longer breaks between vehicles! Go to the {b}Transport panel{/b} and open the bus line by clicking on it. Press the {b}little clock icon{/b} to open the window for adjusting the timetable. Add some more time between vehicle departures. Once you have a line going, take a look at how full the vehicles tend to be. If they are half empty, you should adjust the line to run less frequently. If people are packed in like sardines, you should dispatch vehicles more often.

You may sometimes find yourself in a situation where there's no good way to arrange a route. If you get stuck like this, here's a little trick: {b}build a new road{/b}! You can choose from many different types, and everything affects the flow of traffic in the city. Large {b}avenues{/b} come with traffic lights and have much greater capacity than smaller roads. {b}Small roads{/b} have intersections without traffic lights, and thus are the faster option when you are building in a low-traffic area.

Very well done! Now, {b}trams{/b} are a bit different from buses: they need tracks to run on. Why don't you try your hand at building a line for them? Just choose roads from the {b}Tools panel{/b} and select the tracks. You can lay single tracks or double tracks, whatever you wish! To connect tracks over intersections, first click on the track piece you want to connect, and then select the place where you want it to go.

When your tracks are all built, you can add {b}stops{/b} and a {b}Depot{/b}, just like for a bus line. These can be found under the tram icon in the {b}Tools{/b} panel. Be mindful of which side of the tracks you place each stop, so your trams can reach it. Try adding eight stops now. Remember to connect the Depot to the tracks to make sure your trams can reach the line!

Open the {b}Transport{/b} panel and add a new tram line. Choose {b}Add stops{/b} and start by clicking on the {b}Depot{/b} to make it the first stop. Choose the stops in the order you want the tram to visit them, and then choose the Depot again to complete the line.

Click on the {b}Depot{/b} to open it, or select it from the {b}Transport{/b} panel, and then buy enough vehicles to get your line going. You can always check how many vehicles your line needs by looking at the line window. For now, buy three trams.

Sometimes you need to {b}take a loan{/b} to handle the up-front expenses to get your company going. Banks offer you loans, so you should check out the possibilities. Don't be afraid to take on loans, as they offer you a great chance to build bigger! Try it out! Take out a loan by selecting the option in the {b}Economy{/b} panel.

There's lots of information available, which shows how your company is doing. Have a look at the {b}Graphs{/b} panel, which is situated in the bottom bar. You can find many different graphs about your company and the city, such as how your coverage has developed and how the city is growing. Open the Company Value graph.

Pricing is also of great importance. To pay your loans, you might need to adjust {b}ticket prices{/b}. Also note that the economic situation is likely to change every once in a while. Keep an eye out for displeased passengers and adjust your prices accordingly! Just now you could {b}lower them a bit{/b}, lets say by .20 for now. You can adjust single ticket prices, multi-zone tickets for every vehicle type separately, or you can simply raise or lower all prices.

You can set customized ticket {b}price zones{/b}. Just use the {b}Zone{/b} tool and paint the zones however you like. You can have up to four different prize zones. In small towns, zones are not very useful, but {b}they are essential in large cities{/b}. You can set the price of inter-zone tickets in the {b}Economy{/b} panel under Ticket Prices.

You also control the {b}wages{/b} paid to your employees. Higher wages bring a variety of benefits. For example, mechanics with higher wages use their time more efficiently and can thus take care of more vehicles. Have a look at the wages by opening the {b}Economy{/b} panel, and give everyone a .20 wage increase.

Every scenario has an {b}objective{/b} which you must meet to proceed with the campaign or finish the scenario. You can see the objectives by clicking on the {b}Objectives{/b} tab on the left edge of the screen. This tab shows you how close you are to your goal, and by clicking on it you can consider the task once again to refresh your memory. Now it's time to {b}complete the objective{/b} and finish the tutorial!
You have now completed the tutorial! Press {b}Next{/b} to start playing.
Build a metro line to complete the tutorial.

Good day to you! I'm Stephanie York, the mayor of the city. We are so glad to have you here! The citizens have been asking for a public transport system for a long time! For me, the most important thing is to keep citizens happy and make the city grow. You can get to work immediately!
Excellent work, I'm impressed! Lets see what else we can achieve together.
Some citizens are jealous because they don't have as good connections as those who live in another part of the city. That's why I think coverage should be one of your main concerns.
That's great! Everyone is so pleased!
Welcome to our little town! My name is Ivanovic, and I currently run the city. I'm so glad you have come! There is much to do. We don't have any transport system at present, so anything goes.
Thank you so much for your help! We will be taking good care of the company you set up, and we will send you the monthly profits.
Hello there and welcome! I These truly are grim times for my town! We need more workers, specially white collar workers! The offices are craving new workers. Please help us!
Great work! While you are gone, I'll hire people to run the company. You will naturally receive a check for any profit we make; it will be sent every month.
It is so good to have you back! Lets get that company going. Company value is so important: it measures how well the company is doing. Plus, it gives you bragging rights!
Well done! I love what you have done with the network. Let's continue the same way.
There are many new factories in the city, and they are desperately looking for workers. I'd like you to help us attract more blue collar workers to the city!
Good news, the factories are doing great! They bring in a nice amount of money, and of course this brings new commuters for your transportation system, too.

We need more citizens, and we need even better coverage over the whole city. We just won an award for the most attractive city on the continent, so we simply need to keep going, and make sure we cater to the new citizens who are going to flock to our city.
Good job! Let me introduce you to someone in need of help. You might be just the person they need...

Welcome! You came just in time! I'm the mayor, but I have no experience in running a city. I didn't even want the position! Please, help me with the transport system. The citizens are so angry with me, and I don't know what to do! Oh, and you can call me Bruce. Nice to meet you!
Thank you for your invaluable help! I don't know how we could have managed without you. You'll be receiving some nice profits! Just watch your account!

Hello, hello! Yes, we have met before! Remember Ivanovic, from the last town? Yes, that's me! Now, this little city needs better connections, just like most places you visit. Could you help us out? We need to increase our population as well, so it's easier to keep the system going. I would be very happy if you could look into it!

What a great job you have done! To be honest, I was a little worried at first, but now you have shown me what a professional you are! Thank you so much! I'll be directing the company profits directly to your company accounts.

You handled that with great elegance! Now, we still need you around here. I was thinking it would be a good idea to increase the company value, so we can attract even more people to the city. What do you think?
Well done! This should keep us going for quite a while.
This might be a little too much to ask, but could you improve the coverage even further? I feel it's the key to success, and the citizens would surely benefit.
Excellent work! I must admit, I thought I might have asked for too much this time, but you did great!

We have come a long way, and the city is doing very well. I suggest we make the city grow even more. Perhaps the company could do better still? I've heard that it takes money to make money. If that's true, we should attract plenty of it!

I simply cannot thank you enough for what you have done here! The city is doing better than ever, our citizens are pleased, and everything is working perfectly. You have done a tremendous job, and I'm very grateful, as are all our citizens. I hope you continue your great work in other cities, so that other people can enjoy you systems, too!
Good day! I represent the local board of educational and I'm here to ask for your help. We are looking to improving the commute to one of our schools.
Excellent work! The students asked me to pass on their thanks.

Hello! I'm Lauren O'Brien and I'm a tram fanatic -- I know, I know, you're thinking that's a bit silly, but I'm not the only one.. In fact there's a whole club of us: "The Tramtastics", and we are dying to see loads more trams in our city!
Awesome! I've spotted a lot more trams running throughout the city lately! Pure poetry in motion! Thank you!
I'm glad I caught you! My company's having a spot of bother -- many of our new employees don't own cars. Could you please improve the travel connections to our company offices?
Great news -- productivity has risen and we've had fewer people coming in late. Good job!

Sup dude?! Yeah man, it's like, pollution… it's totally uncool, right? So look, dog -- how's about upping the metro network and keepin' the gas-guzzlers off the road? Jus' think 'bout what we doin' to the planet, you follow?
Sweet! You, like, totally expanded your coverage, reduced the carbon footprint -- you're an eco-warrior, dude!

Hello, this is Maria calling from the local fertility clinic. Our records are showing a steady increase in the population of this city and we would like to see this growth continue. Perhaps if we were to build more new roads and add some new transit lines we'd encourage even more people to move into the city?
We're in the middle of a real baby-boom! Thank you for your help!

How do you do, my name is Andy Franco, assistant to the Mayor. We've noticed there is an increasing demand for your services in the city and we would like to request that you increase your coverage, if that's possible.
The Mayor asked me to convey his appreciation of your efforts and requested that I present you with this small token of his gratitude.

Hello, my name is Heidi and I'm calling you from your own PR department. I'm not trying to tell you how to do your job, but you'd make our lives a whole lot easier if you spent some time improving the company's reputation. Thanks for taking the time to listen!
That's great! We've been receiving tons of positive feedback on our company's profile!

My name is Don Rump, and I've got just one piece of advice for you: Location, location, location. The strategic placement of transportation lines can make businesses -- and the city -- grow. I'm looking to be impressed: let's see if you can do better than my last apprentices. They weren't up to the challenge of revitalizing the city just north of here.
Congratulations! Even the buildings are taller! Makes the town less windy, too -- no need to glue on my toupee anymore!

Chips - specialized, hi-tech chips -- that's what I deal in. We manufacture them at our own facilities, then ship them off for use at our factories. That's synergy for you. For reasons I'd rather not go into, we need a consistent means of transporting the chips from our manufacturing plant to multiple locations around the city and your trolley buses are our best option. I realize this may sound a little strange, but I assure you there is a sound technical reason for this.
We are receiving a steady flow of chips at our various locations! Thank you very much!
Hi, I'm David and I want to offer you a unique opportunity! If you expand your transportation fleet, I'll make it worth your while! Why? Because I'm an eccentric philanthropist!

Thank you! I'm delighted you accepted my offer -- I just love performing random acts of irrational kindness and you made my day! I won't forget you, you know -- I might even have some more work for you in the future.

Good day, I'm calling on behalf of David, the eccentric philanthropist. As his treasurer, I am authorized to present you with this generous offer of assistance. I do hope you decide to accept. Just one thing, please make sure you comply with his request to the very letter. David's rather particular in that respect.
David sends his regards, along with a more than generous donation to your cause.

Hello, I am personal assistant to David the eccentric philanthropist and I've been asked see if you qualify as a benefactor to the city's student. If you are, I am to reward you handsomely. He muttered something strange about it being of the utmost importance how transportation is ordered, so, to be on the safe side, you better do things in the exact order he requested.
Your contributions are of great importance to the future of this city. David, along with the students of the city, applaud your actions.

Hi, I'm David the eccentric philanthropist's sister. My brother doesn't usually do this, but he's been having a really rough day so he sent me over to deliver this really bizarre request. He insisted that everything had to be carried out in a specific order -- something to do with his obsessive compulsive disorder, I expect... Just don't shoot the messenger!
You actually managed to do that!? Well, you certainly cheered David up -- though I'm not sure he'd ever admit to asking you to do it. Anyway, you earned your reward!

Er, hello? I'm David the eccentric philanthropist's cousin -- I'm currently between jobs so he sent me round to deliver this request. If you ask me, he must really have it in for you to even consider asking this but... And he was very specific about the order he wanted it done -- said he wanted it to 'reflect human growth', or something.
Man, he sure had you jumping through hoops! Nicely done though, I must say!

Hello and how are you doing today?! My name's Sarah and I'm here specially to present a unique promotional campaign: Cheaper Than Peanuts! Buy your new buses today and take full advantage of our partial refund offer! It's the deal of a lifetime! Act now and you'll also receive a bonus set of kitchen knives!
Thank you for your bus purchase. You should receive your bonus shortly. Have a nice day.

Hello! I'm Anya and I'm delighted to be in a position to share with you our latest promotional campaign: Cheaper Than Fudge! Simply purchase your metros now and enjoy a partial refund! It's the deal of a lifetime! Act now and you'll also receive a silly hat at no extra charge!
Thank you for your metro purchase. You should receive your bonus shortly. Have a nice day.

Allow me to introduce myself -- my name's Mark and I'd like to showcase our latest promotional campaign: Cheaper Than Raisins! For every tram purchased you earn a complementary partial refund! It's the deal of a lifetime! Act now and you'll also receive a bonus gift: a pair of 'Miracle Shears' - cuts everything from paper to cardboard!
Thank you for your tram purchase. You should receive your bonus shortly. Have a nice day.

Well hello there! Phil's the name and I can't wait to share with you our new promotional campaign: Cheaper Than Tacos! All trolley buses purchased right now are currently eligible for a partial refund! It's the deal of a lifetime! Act now and you'll also receive a single, multi-purpose oven mitt!
Thank you for your trolley bus purchase. You should receive your bonus shortly. Have a nice day.

Hello! I'm Andy and I'm legally blind. I'm contacting you regarding an exciting new promotional opportunity -- our 'Cheaper Than Spaghetti' campaign allows you to buy your boats now and receive a partial refund! It's the deal of a lifetime! Act now and you'll also receive a complementary apple -- to keep those doctors away! As a legal disclaimer I would like to reiterate the fact that I am blind and cannot be held responsible for the existence of water, or lack thereof, in your particular region. All boat purchases do not include the water necessary for optimum operation.
Thank you for your boat purchase. You should receive your bonus shortly. Have a nice day.

I am a follower of the all-mighty Mechanic and I demand you establish public transportation routes to our Garage. All vehicles are created equal under the all-seeing eye of the Mechanic. Every nut and bolt is an integral part of the unifying Engine.
The Mechanic is well pleased and, when the time comes, will grant all your vehicles passage to the Great Junkyard. We thank you.

I am a follower of the great Mechanic and he has decreed that there should be equality amongst your vehicles. It is written in sacred Scriptures of the Dashboard that all methods of public transportation are created in the Engine's image. Please respect the Mechanic's will.
The Mechanic is most grateful. Your vehicles have all received the blessing of the Hood Ornament. We thank you.

I follow the highway of the all-powerful Mechanic. All shall kneel before Him, who declares all vehicles to be equal. It is a fundamental right of all vehicles to multiply and fill the great Engine, as is laid out in the Scriptures of the Dashboard.
The Mechanic has been appeased and the teachings of the Dashboard remain in harmony. We thank you.

I am a lowly follower of the Mechanic, lubricated be His name. He guides my Steering Wheel in his infinite, vehicular wisdom. He watches over our cars when we are gone. He brings balance to our Wheels, and yet, in his mysterious ways, throws his Wrench into the Engine. Woe be unto us that must endure these Carbon Times. The Scriptures of the Dashboard require us to create imbalance in order to achieve balance.
The Mechanic has achieved a state of equilibrium and the mighty Engine is running smoothly once more. We thank you.

This is Professor Jones from the Institute of Archeology. We've located an important historical site right under your city, but due to those darned planning regulations, we can't access it. So, here's our proposal - you put in a new a metro line and we take advantage of the construction site to uncover the secrets of lost civilizations.
Excellent! Now, just let me grab my hat and whip, and I'll be on my way… I'm off on a new adventure to discover more ancient secrets! Thank you once again!

Hello, this is Marion, calling on behalf of Professor Jones. If you recall, the last metro tunnel you dug lead to an amazing discovery. Well, the professor has since circled the world twice over in an rickety old plane and now he's returned and is anxious to start his next adventure. Apparently the last excavation site has a twin close by and we were wondering if you'd agree to a similar arrangement?
Thank you! At last we can finally discover the secrets of that ancient civilization!

Greetings. My name is Sallah Mohammed and I understand you are the only person who can help us. My dear old friend Professor Jones has landed himself in a bit of a pickle. He was excavating under your city and unfortunately there was a cave-in. Amazingly, he also uncovered the tomb of an ancient ruler, so we could really use your help to establish yet another metro access point.

Much appreciated, my friend. We finally got our hands on some wonderful archeological treasures which had been lying buried under our feet for thousands of years. Now our city's museums will truly be world famous!

This is Gretel, from the local Girl Scouts troop. We were hoping you could help us. We've got a brand new club house, but it's a bit hard to get to, so we were hoping you could make it easier for us to reach.
You're the best! Now we can get there easily. Thank you so much!

My best friend Gretel asked you to help with the Girl Scout's club house a while back, remember? Well, could you help us again, please? We're having a regional Girl Scout gathering downtown. Could you make sure it's easy to reach -- we don't want the visiting Girl Scouts to get lost?
Thank you ever so much! I'm sure our visitors will enjoy seeing round our lovely city! Thank you!

I'm Dan and I own the local art gallery. I’m hosting the opening of a new exhibition and I'm expecting guests from all over the world, but I'm a little concerned about transportation. I need a clear route linking the opening, my gallery and the hotel. Could you help me out?
Thank you! The event was a great success and everyone commented on the quality of the transportation!

Nice to meet you! I'm Andy, Assistant Engineer at the factory that supplies your buses. Last month we exceeded our production quota, so we'd really appreciate it if you bought some more buses from us.
Thank you! I'm sure the new buses will be an asset to your company!

Salaam! Surely you must have heard of me, the famous sheik Hassan? I am opening an office in your fine city, but I have a problem. My villa is a little inconvenient for my cleaning lady, handyman, driver, gardener, and cook to reach. Would you please show me your kindness and hospitality, and make it possible for my staff to get to my house?
Marvelous, I am so pleased! Finally my villa is getting the attention it deserves. Please accept this modest token of my gratitude.

Dude, rock on! We’re organizing a jam session for our band, and it's gonna be awesome - we've not played a gig yet, but soon, man... We're going to make it big time, y'know? There's just one thing: our violinist lives too far away. Any chance you could, y'know, set up a route so she can get to practice more easily? I mean, she's, like, totally smokin' and we don't want to lose her...
Monster! We totally kicked... and I think I'm in love! Thanks, dude!

Hey, man! Danny's the name, head honcho of the local motorcycle club. We ol' time bikers have to deal with rusted bikes... Fact is, most of the time our hogs are in the shop getting fixed or tuned. So we kinda rely on public transportation pretty much. Could you help us out and add a stop close to our garage? We bikers are some of your best customers, y'know...
Thanks man! Our bikes are in the shop and we can still get around the city. Here, we passed round the hat, just to let you know how grateful we are.

Good day. Do you have a moment to spare? I'm a member of a secret ring of spies currently operating within your city -- or at least we are trying to. It's quite simple: the greater the public transportation options, the harder we are to trace. Could you please increase transportation so we can pass undetected more easily? Thank you for your cooperation.
Our agents remain undetected and the exchange of secret information is flowing much more freely now. Thank you.
Hello, I'm Kate from the Women's Union. We are holding a seminar and we would really appreciate it if you could help us organize transportation between our main event locations.
Thank you so much! The seminar was a great success and you helped make it happen.

Spare a thought for the little ones! I'm Sandy Newport from Save All Living Things. We're greatly troubled by the number of ignorant, unfeeling feet trampling the ground -- do you know how many innocent insects get crushed every single second? Could you help us in our campaign to help humans keep their clumsy feet off the ground?
Thank you! Now the cute wee critters are a bit safer! I'm sure you'll sleep more soundly knowing that there are more spiders in the world!

I'm a local producer and retailer of spandex hoodies and I'd appreciate your help. I'm just opening a new shop and although its location isn't ideal, I'm anticipating that the city will soon expand and then my shop will be in a prime spot for business. Right now, however, it still needs better connections, so if you could spare the time to look into it I'd be really grateful. My line of casual wear really is the best you can buy, you know!
Thanks! I'm sure we'll build a steady customer base over the next year or so and we'll have you to thank!

Hi, I'm Rudolf -- I make documentaries about public transportation and I've selected your city to feature in my next blockbuster. I envision this movie to be enigmatic, yet forceful in its message. Unfortunately we still have a few details to iron out -- basically, your current network doesn't fully reflect our artistic vision. Could you be a dear and just pop in a few extra stops here and there? I'm utterly convinced that these new sites would perfectly capture the dichotomy of intrigue versus functionality that is at the very heart of your city's public transportation system.
Excellent! The routes look perfect! I'm sure our cinematic masterpiece will bring people flocking to marvel at the beauty of your system.

Hello, I'm Rudolf's assistant. Turns out we need to shoot some extra footage for the film and you're going to have to make a few additional changes to your network. Yes, I know, bummer… But it'll be good publicity for company!
We got some great footage! It should be more than enough to finish the film. Thanks!

Hi, I'm Rudolf's new assistant. He's busy finalizing his new script right now, but he asked me to tell you that his last movie was a runaway hit and that gave him the inspiration for his latest project: nightlife in the big city. We'd love to feature your impressive transportation network.
We got everyone to the set on time! I'm sure this is going to be a masterpiece! Thank you for your assistance – we could never have done it without you!

My name is Oscar Magoo and I run a local bakery. In fact, my little shop is right nearby and I was wondering if you'd be able to add a line there. Many of my employees don't own their own car so they rely on public transport.
Wonderful! This truly will help my business expand -- and you've made my employees very happy. Thank you!

Good day to you! As you probably know, I'm the bishop of this diocese and I'm here to ask a favor. We don't get as many worshipers as we once used to and I believe one of the main reasons is that our church is hard to reach. Could you set up a direct line?
Thank you! I'm sure people will flock to the church now! How lovely it will be to see our parishioners more often!

Hello, I believe you might be able to help me. I've been trying to keep in contact with one of our CIA agents, but we're running out of places we can meet inconspicuously. A bus line would be perfect! – No one would suspect two people who just happened to be traveling on the same bus. Could you help us?
Excellent, the new line works like a charm! No one suspects anything! After all, lots of people share the same routes. Thank you for your help!

Nice to meet you! My name's Mary and I just moved here. I was hoping to bring my whole family with me, but there's a small problem: I have a beautiful home, but it's too far from the school. I don't have a drivers license and my wife is at work all day. Could you help us? We need a direct line from our house to the school, so my children don't miss class.
Thank you ever so much! Now my children can get to school easily and my wife is pleased!

How y'all doin'! I've come to ask you a small favor -- I just bought me an office building right here in the city. Seemed like a mighty fine investment at the time, that is 'til I came to notice the poor public transport connections. Now I can get there just fine in my limousine, but my regular workers -- the secretaries and such – well, it ain’t quite so easy for them. Could you lend me a hand here? I never forget a good deed!
Thanks, friend! You sure did a mighty fine job! Now all my employees can use public transport – which leaves a whole lot more parking space for my limousine.
Good day to you. I'm Arnold Pagini, and I'm setting up a new business in your lovely city, but I've run into difficulties. My employees can't get to my office easily. Could you help me?
Excellent, simply excellent! I don't know what I'd have done without your help. Please accept this small gift for your trouble.

I'm Henry, president of the students' association. We've just opened a new student dorm, and it's really far out! I mean, literally… it's far out – and that’s the problem. We need to be able to get there. Do you think you could help us?
That's great, that did the trick! Thanks!

Hey man, how's it goin'? Me an' my bros are lookin' to spread the love, but we bustin' our vibe on account of all them blisters we getting' from our kicks. We lookin' fine, but we need to be chillin' not walkin', y'know what I mean? Think you could add a few lines, so we can keep in touch with our peeps?
Dude, you cool! And we're definitely spreadin' the vibe. We chillin'...

Hello, my name's Fred and I'm the CEO of the leading mobile games company around here. We've just opened a new office and it would be great if you could add a route that connects it to our factory. We would prefer a tram line, but any form of transport would be fine. I hope you can help!
Excellent. Now our employees can leave their cars at home! Hey, what would you say to free games for the rest of your life?

Could do me a favor? I've just opened a brand new casino -- the biggest one in the city. It has plenty of parking space for limos and such, but I want to attract people from all walks of life. Could you set up a direct route there?
Nice work! Now my casino is buzzing with customers and the money is rolling in! Don't worry, we'll see you get your share -- here you go!

Sorry to bother you. I'm John and I work at the Great Gadget factory. Me and my mates were just wondering if you'd consider building a line out there. There's a lot of us working at the factory, and we'd all be really grateful if you could help us out. Any form of transportation will do – we're not picky!
Thanks a bunch! Everyone at the factory is really happy with the new route! Even the boss said she was thinking of using public transport instead taking her car!

Good day. I own practically all the casinos in the city and I've come to ask for your assistance with a small matter. Most of my potential customers choose to stay a certain five star hotel (I think you know which one I'm referring to...). Could you make sure that they have easy access to the casino?
Well done! And please, if ever you're in need if a little relaxation, drop by my casino – I can offer you a wonderful deal!

Hi, I'm Paul -- a student at the University. I need to talk to you about something. The students were promised a new metro line a few years back, but I guess someone just forgot about it. We still need to get around and I thought perhaps since you're in charge now, maybe you'd set up a line for us? Anything will do – as long as it's cheap!
Sweet, this'll make our lives much easier! Thank you! We won't forget this…

Nice to meet you. I'm Larry, chairman of the cycling club. We've been fans of your trams for quite a while and we'd like you to purchase a few more of them. You see, they make our lives easier -- fewer cars on the road!
Thanks! Now the city's a nicer -- and safer --place to cycle!

Hello! I purchased some office buildings a couple years back and now it seems my investment is finally paying off. I'd like to get the highest price possible when I sell, and in order for that to happen the buildings need good local transport connections. Do you think you could help me?
Many thanks. Great work. The property value is sure to sky-rocket now that they're so well served by public transportation.

Hi, my name's Vito and I've got a problem only you can fix. I've made a deal with few of the local shopkeepers to send some customers their way. The best way to make this happen, of course, is to make sure the customers can reach the shops easily. So you see, public transportation is the key. Could you build a line for us? I'm sure this route would attract many, many passengers, so it would be a good deal for you too.
Great, the line is working beautifully! I'm sure you'll make a huge profit, but here's a little something extra for your trouble.

Howdy, partner. I see you've been doin' very well for yourself around here. Mighty nice work! Now, I've a small favor to ask: I'm fixin' to bring in some of my luxury goods to sell but, to my mind, the shops in these parts need better connections. Do you think you could see your way to helpin' me out?
Well now… My goods are selling like hot cakes! Business sure is booming, and I hope yours does likewise. I owe you one, partner!

Salaam! I am Hussein. I am trying to set up some offices, because I believe this city is destined to be one of the greatest in the world. Sadly, the finest buildings are a bit too far apart. Do you think you could put in some connections? I would be most grateful!
Excellent! Splendid! You are doing a fine job, I tell you! My offices are now the pride of the company.

Ciao! I am Giovanni, the greatest artist in all of Italy, no, in the whole world! I will give to you the honor of performing a simple task – my favorite theater requires better connections. Yes, I choose you to be the fortunate one to build a new line there!

What now? I'm in the middle of something important! Oh, it's only you. Please to excuse the tar and feathers. I am practicing for my next performance. It is good that you got the job done, now that is all… ciao!
Listen, could you help me out? Lately I've been dreaming I was on a bus driving though my old neighborhood. Could you put in a line that runs through the areas where I grew up?
Ah, that was wonderful -- it was all just as I remembered! Thank you so much!

Good day to you! I run a cinema here in the city – a proper art cinema, that is... We only screen the latest Asian art films, along with the occasional classic or two. For our opening night we intend to premier a real gem – a 4 hour film documenting daily life in a small Chinese village. It's too good to miss! I was hoping you could help me with the transportation arrangements, since naturally I'm expecting a horde of viewers to show up. It would be a service to Art if you could set up a line for my patrons. Do you think you could help me out?
Ah, just in time! The film is about to start! Thank you so much for helping me – it means a lot.

Hello, I'm Celine, and I own of some of the largest hotels in the city. I'm trying to steer my enterprises in a more environmentally friendly direction and having good public transport connections would be a great start. I'm planning to offer all my employees a raise if they switch to public transport – so I believe you could benefit from this also. All I ask is that you ensure my businesses are easy to reach!
Thanks, that's great! There's already an increase in the number of customers. And don't worry, I haven't forgotten about you: here's a little something for helping me out!

I'm part of a nature awareness association and we need your help: our new meeting place is really hard to get to! Ideally we'd prefer to travel there by bus, but it would have to be one with low emissions to cut down on pollution... Oh, and it should drive slowly to allow our furry friends time to get off the road! Could you help us?

Thank you! We really love the new line. There are some totally amazing views along the route and the drivers all seem to be genuine nature lovers, since they drive nice and slowly. One even stopped to allow a family of ducks to cross the road!

Oh, quelle horror! My latest exhibition is scheduled to open soon, but for some reason my audience has proved too dense to interpret my dada-influenced advertisements correctly. They have no idea where the exhibition is being held! I need mass transit to get everyone there – even if they have shown themselves to be unworthy of my sophisticated art!

The exhibition is poised for its grand opening and finally it has the large audience it deserves. They should be quivering in anticipation -- a multi-sensory spectacle featuring rotten eggs and hamsters awaits them!

I'm Mr. Mackay from the Agricultural Association. We recently opened a new office in town. Could you ensure that we can travel freely between the office and our main headquarters? It would save us a lot of time and we would be willing to compensate you for your trouble.
Wonderful, this will save the Agricultural Association a great deal of time and money. Oh, and don't worry, your check is in the mail!

The Filthy Rich Club is organizing its annual outing -- we like to travel around the city just like an 'average Joe'. However, we are having a problem reaching our desired locations... Do you think you could help us?
The trip was a huge success -- a real lark! Thank you!

Good morning! I must speak with you concerning an urgent matter! I have an important mission for you -- provided you are willing to take the necessary risks. First, I must have your word that this conversation will remain entirely confidential. This matter is top secret, you understand. Very well, the issue is this: we have several undercover offices in secret locations throughout the city center, but having our service vehicles coming and going at all hours is beginning to attract unwanted attention. The solution: public transport. Your country needs you to add a new line!
Splendid, our cover is no longer under threat. Thank you for your dedication – it will not go unrewarded!

We represent the youth of the city and we demand a better public transportation system to guarantee the future of our beloved city. We want to see it develop and become prosperous and important. Build more lines now!
Good, now the younger population is free to move without borders! Thank you for your time and effort.

Hey man, Paulie here! Dude, are we in trouble!! The Rainbow Community Collective just got this new house – it's totally wicked, y'know, but it's too far away! You think you could help us? Maybe put in a bus stop over there and, like, another one over here? You gotta help us out, man...
Awesome! Now we're sure to have way more folk coming to our gatherings. Truth is, we've been a bit short of members recently...

I am readying myself for what is bound to be my Greatest Work Ever! It’s going to be a live performance, right here in the city -- how thrilling! Picture this: me, simply slathered in honey, and five hundred bees – people won’t be able to take their eyes off the stage! Of course, it’s a stark, chillingly artistic representation, designed to explore the true essence of humanity in the modern world. As ever, the plebs in the audience probably won’t be able to find their own way to the event (yawn!), so could you be a dear and help them? We wouldn’t want them to miss it now, would we?
Oh, peachy, darling, thanks ever so! My audience is starting to gather – and just in time, too... My bees are getting restless.

I represent the Modern Ladies Association and, on behalf of my fellow women, I would like to make a request. We have several small offices located around the city in order to be easily accessible to all the good folk engaged in their daily battle for equality. It would be invaluable to our cause if all our offices were linked by a direct line – then our employees could move easily from office to office, as needed.
I, and the MLA, thank you! This will greatly assist our whole association. It was a pleasure working with you.
Hello, I understand you are in charge of public transport? I'd like to ask for a favor: I've been watching grow the city since its infancy and I'd like to see it become even bigger than it is now.
Thank you! You're the best! I'm sure you've got more customers now, too!
Hey there… Me and the lads are only laborers, but we're your best customers, y'know - after all, we're lost without public transport. Could you help us out a bit?
Thanks, you've really made life a bit easier for us workers!

I say! You there! Stand up straight and pay attention, young man... The residents at the Old and Wrinkly want to be able to get to their favorite shop -- they have the cheapest potatoes in town, so it's important. The way prices are going up these days is simply shocking! So it's your job to put in a line there, see?!
Hrrrumph! About time! Those potatoes had better still be on sale!

Hello, I'd like to ask a bit of a favor. I lost my job and now I don't have anything to do all day, so my friends and I came up with the idea of a line going all round the city, so people could go sightseeing. I'm sure it would make you a ton of money – and I'm giving you my idea for free!
Great, I'll ride the line every day!

Let me just say what a fine city you have here! I'd love to see more of it, but it appears that there is no line at present that will take me to my intended destination. Maybe you would consider building one?
Wow, quick work! That's really impressive! I can't wait to see what I've been missing!

Good day to you. I'm looking to make a deal. I work for a company that has its two main offices in the city, and traveling back and forth between them is inefficient and time consuming. A new connecting line would make the commute more convenient and save me a significant amount of time. I'm willing to offer a substantial financial incentive in return for your cooperation. What's your answer?
Excellent work! Time is money, you know! Here's a small token of our appreciation!

Hi, me and the girls were just wondering if you were planning to add a direct line from the factory to the city center? We'd love to be able to pop into town for lunch and do some shopping every now and then. Do you think you could look into it?
That’s awfully nice of you, thanks! Now we don't have to eat that dreadful cafeteria food!

Listen, I'm in a terrible hurry right now and this traffic is killing me! Could you make sure there's an easy way for me to get to work from my home? I'll make sure there's a little something in it for you!
Good job, well done! This will cut my commute time in half and allow me to spend more time at my desk.

Hello, I'd like to request a line going from my house and my favorite shopping plaza. I'm sure a lot of other people would use it too -- in fact I've already told all my neighbors it's great place to shop!
Thanks! I'm on my way to do some shopping right now!

Please could you help me? I don't have a car and my best friend has just bought a new house that's not within walking distance. I really miss chatting with her – and sharing her yummy cookies! Do you think you could you add a route going over there?
Thanks, I'll send you some cookies!
Hello, I was wondering if you'd mind looking into something for me. My car broke down and I need to get to work somehow... Do you think you could put in a direct line? It would be a great help.
Thanks ever so much! Now I can get to work, no problem! In fact, I’m even considering selling my car once I've had it repaired.

Hello dearie! Well now... on Wednesdays me and a few other seniors like to go down to the bingo hall to play a bit of bingo together, but lately it seems like we've lost some of our regulars. Some folks are saying it’s simply too hard to get there these days, so I thought I’d give you a call and see if you might be able to help us out!
Bingo! Bless you, dearie, now our bingo nights are packed!

Hi, I've come to ask you a favor. Me and some mates of mine from college get together to play board games on Saturdays for a bit of a laugh. But some are calling it off on account of the trek. It would be totally awesome if you could make sure they could all get here without any bother. Thanks, mate – I owe you.
Thanks, now we’ve enough players to stage a weekend-long Monopoly fest!

That’s it! I’ve finally decided to get rid of my car! There's just one thing still stopping me – I have to visit my mother now and then and she lives really far away. You'll help me out, won’t you? I really want to get rid of that car!
Thanks, the car is up for sale even as we speak! Nothing but public transport for me from now on!

I've got a new job, but since my car broke down I've been finding the commute stressful. I really miss my car – it ran on horse manure so the engine was really quiet. It smelled a bit pongy though... Anyway, do you think you could you help me to get to work?
Thank you! That's much more comfortable than my old car -- and it smells fresher too!
Bus/Trolley stop with shelter and bench
Tram stop with shelter and bench
Metro stop with ticket machine and lighting
Metro stop with ticket machine, timetable and better lighting
Have no private motoring in the city for 48 game hours
Transport 1,500 passengers using 2 vehicles in one game week

City life varies throughout the day and night, and transport needs change accordingly. Most citizens go to work in the morning from 8 to 10 AM, and return home or go to leisure activities after 5 PM.\n\nThere is a separate timetable for weekdays, morning rush, evening rush, weekends, and you can even make custom timetables. To adjust one, choose a timetable tab and modify the start and end times or intervals. You can have many different vehicles in the Depot, and order that the line prefer certain size vehicles. However, if there are any available vehicles when a line is required to dispatch one, any type will be sent to keep the customers happy.

The Depot is where vehicles are stored and maintenanced. One Depot can serve many lines, and in fact you can use the same vehicle on more than one line. You always buy vehicles at a Depot, and every vehicle must have a home Depot.

The {b}View Info{/b} button shows you all the basic information, including who owns the depot, what lines operate from it, and how many vehicles are available. The {b}Vehicle List{/b} lets you browse all the vehicles that use the Depot.

{b}Buy Vehicles{/b} is where you purchase new vehicles: this option opens the shop window to let you browse all available vehicles. Next there's the {b}Edit Name{/b} button. To better distinguish one depot from another, you can give each a unique name. The last button is for centering the view on the depot to see where it is on the map.

Each line has its own window. With the {b}View info{/b} option you can check approximately how many vehicles the line needs to maintain the current timetables, the line's length, its income and expenses, and all its other basic information.

Under its {b}Stops List{/b} you can find all the stops the line visits and the status of each stop, for example, whether the passengers waiting are unhappy. 

The {b}Vehicles List{/b} shows you the vehicles currently operating on the line. If none are running, the list is empty, but as soon as one is despatched from a depot it will appear on the list.

The next button is for the {b}Timetables{/b}, to make sure your lines run as often as the passengers wish, and also to ensure that they meet with connecting lines at the right time. You can also name each line to make it more individual, as well as center on the depot that the line is using as its home.
The economy affects the interest rates of loans, and how much citizens are willing to pay for tickets. When economy is down, it is better to lower your fares and take out loans.

Shows how long an average trip takes, divided by social groups. When displaying the daily numbers, peaks show when traffic is the busiest. You might want to optimize your timetables during peak times, or add vehicles.
How many trips does each social group take? When there are lots of trips, this could mean your system needs greater capacity: larger vehicles, or more frequent routes.
Which social group takes the greatest percentage of its trips by walking? The ones that walk the most could be excellent future passengers, if you provide them with routes.

Which social group most often uses their private cars, and when? At peak vehicle usage times, you might wish to add more vehicles to your lines, or see where the most car-using social groups are travelling, so you can build more routes for them.
How many people are unemployed in each social group? Not having a job affects how much people are willing to pay for tickets, and whether they travel to work or not.

Who uses your services, and when? Optimize your timetables for the times when there's a dip in the graph, or add more lines. If there's a social group that rarely uses your services, go to Map Data and see where they are and where they want to go. Building new lines for them can increase your profits.

Shows city population organized by social groups, in terms of population growth. Is one social group shrinking? If so, there might not be enough houses or workplaces. Try building a few roads to make some room for new buildings.

Shows traffic density on roads, tracks, and the average of both. If, for example, you have a lot of traffic on roads and hardly any on tracks, you might want to invest in traffic types that operate on tracks.
Energy prices fluctuate with the economy. When diesel prices are high, for example, you should raise ticket prices on vehicle types that use diesel, or you may start losing money.

How quickly and easily do your routes take the passengers where they want to go? A low rating indicates that passengers need to take detours to get to their destinations. Look at the Map data to see where people want to go.
How much usage each vehicle type gets. If one type is very popular, you might build more of the same, or alternatively, concentrate on other vehicle types for the sake of variation.
Is some social group missing or very small? It could be that your lines run at the wrong times, or don't take those passengers where they want to go.
How many stops of each type does your system have? You can see if the types are equal, or if some type is neglected.
How many depots of each type does your system have? You can see if the types are equal, or if some type is neglected.
How many lines of each type does your system have? You can see if the types are equal, or if some type is neglected.

Shows how well connected are the places that people travel to and from. If a social group's coverage is low, this means there are not many routes between the places they travel. Please note that this is not how many houses and workplaces are covered by the network, but rather how well the places are connected.
How many citizens use your company's services? Your popularity will rise with low tickets prices, good coverage, and convenient connections optimized to the citizens' needs.

Tells how many trips citizens decide to make (or not to make) with public transportation, based on the consideration of ticket price. Values above zero indicate choices of using public transport, while values below zero reflect choices against using public transport. If many people are choosing not to use public transport, you might lower prices, or check to see if your routes are optimized for the social group that's not using your services. If blue collar workers need to take a major detour to get to their workplaces, for example, it's likely that they don't want to pay for the long journey, and may choose to take their own car or walk.

How well people like the quality of your services. Measures the comfort of your vehicles and stops. Stops with benches, soda dispensers, TV-screens and the like will make your customers happy with the service quality you offer.
When are monthly ticket owners travelling? By increasing services at times when they are not travelling, you can sell more single fare tickets, which usually bring higher profits.

Shows company reputation with different social groups. Reputation is tied to how well your vehicles keep the schedule, and how overcrowded they are. A good reputation results from a well functioning system with well maintained vehicles, correct timetables, and vehicle sizes to fit all passengers without overcrowding.

Shows how passengers travel between and in zones. High usage in single fare tickets could mean that you have very optimized lines. If "two zone" tickets are the most popular, you might want think about optimizing your zoning, so that passengers will be more likely to use "all zones" tickets, which bring in higher profits.
A low number of inspectors and high ticket prices will encourage people to dodge fares. Hire inspectors and check your pricing to reduce fare dodging.
How often do passengers purchase generic tickets, which are good for all vehicle types?
Divided by vehicle type. Generally there should be more small vehicles, such as buses, trams and trolleys, and fewer large vehicles, such as metros and water buses.

Each column shows profits and losses divided by vehicle type. Under "miscellaneous" you can find information about loan payments and interest. You should optimize your lines if a vehicle type isn't making a profit.

A company's value is based on a variety of assets. How much of your company's value is comprised of infrastructure, and how much by other things? If you are playing a multiplayer game, it's important to keep an eye on your competitors' company values, especially when company value is a main objective.
The friends & families of the developers
Thanks to all our partners worldwide,
in particular our long-term partners, and last, but not least,
a special thanks to all our forum members and supporters,
who are integral to our success.
Cannot bulldoze a depot that contains vehicles!
You need to build a depot before you can buy vehicles!
Too much debt!\nYou cannot take out any more loans!
Some ticket prices are too high
Some ticket prices are too low
Click a stop to add it to the line
Are you sure you want to delete this line?
Failed to join lobby because level not found!
Invite other player(s) to continue the game?\n{0}
Any unsaved changes will be lost.
Height offset: {0} m (Page Up / Page Down)
Cannot join game because it's already full!
Quit ruleset editor?\nThere are unsaved modifications that will be lost!
Load another ruleset?\nThere are unsaved modifications that will be lost!
Create new ruleset?\nThere are unsaved modifications that will be lost!
File is already published!\nUpdate with new version of the file?
City population\n{b}Warning: this affects RAM and CPU usage{/b}
By submitting this item, you agree to the {b}Steam Workshop terms of service{/b}. After the item is submitted you can manage it in Steam Workshop.
File is successfully published and ready to use
File is successfully downloaded and ready to use
Affects how fast the game time proceeds in relation to real time.
Affects how fast or slow the city changes according to player's decisions.\nIf you set this value to zero, the city will stop developing, but new buildings will still pop up when you build new roads.
The likelihood of citizens owning cars.\nPlease note that the map editor also has a setting for car ownership.\nThe Map Editor setting gives the baseline, which this rule then modifies.
Affects how quickly or slowly private cars start and stop.\nDoes not affect the player's vehicles.

Affects how many people live in a city.\nPlease note that raising population also raises CPU usage, which might make the game unstable.\nYou can lower Time speed to make the game more stable with larger populations.
Alter the capacity of all vehicles types.
Affects how expensive vehicle maintenance is.
How attractive to passengers the vehicle is.
How much energy a vehicle consumes.
How quickly or slowly a vehicle starts and stops.
Affects vehicle pricing in the game.
Affects how quickly depots repair vehicles, or how quickly vehicle condition regenerates when in a depot.
How many vehicles a depot can repair at the same time.
Affects how much the upkeep of depots cost the player's company.
Alters how much energy depots require to function.
Modify the maximum distance citizens are willing to walk to a stop or station.
Alter how much maintenance stops require.\nLess maintenance needed means less costs to the player's company.
How attractive stops are to customers. This affects customer satisfaction.
Affects how much energy the player's company must pay for to keep their stops and stations running.
How much stops and stations cost.
Please note this value is multiplied by the All Transport Types rules value.
Please restart the game to apply the resolution changes.
Bus/Trolley/Tram stop with shelter and bench
Bus/Trolley/Tram stop with large shelter and bench

Enhance your gameplay with an all new stop type! Now trams, buses and trolleys can share the same stop, making it even easier for passengers to change vehicles. The set includes a smaller stop for less crowded routes, and a large one to handle lots of traffic.
A welcome addition to your bus fleet, the Stern-Berger Majora is a new bus model that will bring a new boost to your game. An excellent vehicle for inner-city routes!
Trolleys are an excellent way to use electricity instead of expensive diesel. This pack brings you a new trolleys model with top notch performance and a new, modern design.

A new tram in two variations. A larger version for crowded routes to handle masses of passengers, and a smaller version to save in fuel costs, so you won't be paying to move a half-empty tram. Both are sleek, modern models with excellent stats to give you an extra boost to your game.
Surf the waves! The all new Donau Leaper is a smart little boat that offers lots of new options for building water bus lines.
Do you have a line with hard to please customers? The Pavlov Arriva is small, smart and very comfortable to ride. Passengers are sure to flock to this one!
The Comet Sun is pretty average in every way. True, that's not the best of slogans, but the Sun is a well-rounded vehicle with notable capacity and speed. Decent for almost any route!

When your maintenance capacity is under a lot of stress, the Maurice Automaton is the vehicle to choose. It has a sturdy structure and a low maintenance need, making it perfect for busy inner city routes with short intervals.
Need more capacity? The Arnauls 202 has lots of room and then some! It's very slow, but with the large capacity still very useful for routes with lots of passengers.

Not many passengers fit into a Stern-Berger ProTerra, but its energy consumption is so low it basically runs on air! This small but powerful vehicle is the top of the line when it comes to eco-friendly inventions.

Want more buses? Look no further! The Bus Mania pack offers five all-new bus vehicles to spice up the game. Use these modern vehicles to make the most of your existing routes, or build all new lines for these impressive new vehicles, and the citizens will stand and marvel!
The Bergstrom Lyon is slow but carries a lot of passengers, and doesn't consume a lot of energy. This fancy tram will be the talk of the town!

When you need a tram that's eco-friendly, go for the Scanditram Master. Its unusual, futuristic look is sure to have your customers interested and it sure will make people jealous. -- It's not called a Master for nothing!
Low energy consumption and high attractiveness are the Louis Qatar's best qualities. Simply put, it's small, sleek and very nice!
Livingstone SC is the way to go when you want your passengers to be as comfortable as possible, but not at a cost to environment.
When you need speed, look no further than the Scanditram Universe! This fast, small vehicle is built super sleek and almost requires no maintenance.

Trams are truly the salt of the earth. The Tram Tremors pack offers five new trams, each more impressive than the last. Decorate your city streets with new, shiny, modern trams of all shapes and sizes!
It may appear a bit clunky, but don't let looks deceive you! The Trooper has superb capacity, and will tirelessly work any route you assign it.

The catamaran hull of the Toyoka 350 might look a bit old fashioned, but underneath the surface there's plenty of room for passengers. Though it does not excel in other areas, the 350 is an ideal choice when capacity is your chief concern.
This fine futuristic vessel is the answer to all your needs. Though it's very fast, it does not consume much energy, making it a perfect match for those busy but eco-friendly passengers.
While the Ciapada does consume relatively high amounts of fuel, even on short runs, it's a well-rounded vessel and is quite fast and comfortable. It's a fine vehicle for most routes!

The Stingray Peter is a must if you aim to please those demanding passengers who prize comfort above all else. It's very well designed, with the passenger's comfort always in mind, and barely needs any maintenance. Add to this its impressive speed, and who can doubt that this is the finest craft on the waves!

Populate the waters in your city with brand new vessels! Five new waterbuses offer both speed and capacity, and will surely have your passengers pointing and staring in awe as they launch from your depots.

It's a bit slow and requires a fair bit of maintenance, but the TransLink boasts unsurpassed capacity. Due to its slow pace, the vehicle will perform best on routes with many stops and only short distances between them.

The Guide is the pride of the Stern-Berger factories. While it isn't the fastest vehicle available, its special padded seats make it very comfortable for passengers, making it highly attractive to your passengers.

The Iris is a well-rounded vehicle that performs well on most routes. Its moves at a reasonable speed, and has a fine capacity. It requires regular maintenance, but overall it is a fine, mid-line vehicle, with adequate performance through and through.

It you require a highly reliable vehicle that also has a high average speed, the Comet BussCar is the one for you. Its capacity is quite low, and it isn't the most comfortable vehicle in the world, but in all other areas it performs wonderfully.
The OB is a small, fast vehicle perfect for long routes to remote locations. It performs particularly well on long distances thanks to its speed and sturdiness.

Everything is trolleys! This pack offers five new trolleys to liven up your streets. Whether you're looking for speed, capacity, or low maintenance requirements, there's a vehicle here that fits the bill.

The FL9 is a hot new model, fresh from the Crescenta factories -- an instant classic. It offers your passengers a very comfortable ride, and boasts superior capacity. It isn't the fastest vehicle known to man, but performs its duties diligently. It carries such large numbers of passengers that it's really at its best on congested inner city routes.
The Madressa may be slow, but this is the cost of excellent energy efficiency and high capacity. This modern vehicle performs well on busy routes.

Distinguished by peculiar angles and an otherworldly appearance, the new EcoBoost is true to its name -- as it is constructed entirely from recycled materials! The Capitol factories sought something altogether new and eco-friendly, and from this inspiration build an entirely new metro train. The surprising and unique look has already proven very attractive to passengers.

Extra wide seating makes the Rocket a superbly comfortable ride. It's also quite sturdy so it requires little maintenance, and it doesn't consume much energy either. The only downside is its low speed. Comfort comes at a price!

The Metropolis, true to its name, was designed for great, bustling cities. It barely requires any maintenance, thanks to its solid build, and is highly energy efficient. All of this, combined with a high average speed, makes it an excellent vehicle to place on inner city routes which remain busy throughout the day.

Ever wanted a shorter metro for use at night, and a much longer version for rush hour? Well, now it's finally possible! The Metro Madness pack features customizable metro units that you assemble car by car, thus enabling you to easily alter the setup for different timetables. It also boasts five brand new metro trains -- each with three different cars!
Landmark is already placed in the city!
Cannot place more landmarks in a single city!
Transport {2} passengers to unlock another landmark!\n{3} / {2} passengers transported

Give your citizens a new place to go with this grand landmark! Petronas towers will surely make your city seem brand new. Two huge towers connected with a bridge are sleek, shiny and gorgeous, a great addition to any city. Landmarks are a way to show how well your city is doing -- and they are always popular locations, so a line going to a landmark is always likely to be profitable.

Do your citizens thirst some classical music? Of course they do -- and why shouldn't they? An Opera House is a fine addition to any city. Such a landmark, with its perfect, organic arches, is sure to draw great crowds, and will always be a profitable transport location.

What city could not be improved by a vast luxury hotel? The Burj Al-Arab skyscraper is modern, sophisticated, and exquisitely luxurious, and will surely be very popular with your citizens. Such a landmark always attracts interest, so any line going to it will be frequented by many citizens.
The number one symbol of Germany, the Brandenburg Gate, is a very popular destination in any city. Place it in your city and it will surely draw a crowd!
The gothic elegance of the Cologne Cathedral is unsurpassed. Place this landmark in your city, and watch as the masses flock to it.
Sleek, modern and gherkin-like, this landmark promises to be one of the busiest places in town. Building a line to it will always bring you profit!
The seat of royalty, Buckingham Palace, is quite dignified and stately, and a classic tourist destination. Your citizens will love to go there to ogle the magnificent structure!
The Rathause is a sublime sight, and is sure to draw lots of people. You should definitely build some lines going to it!
Elizabeth Tower houses the huge bell famously known as Big Ben. It's all a part of Westminster Palace, and a sure place to attract lots of citizens on sunny days.
Monorail stop with ticket machine and lighting

Marvellous Monorails offers an all-new vehicle type to Cities in Motion 2. The monorail is a handy vehicle for innercity connections and works best in circular lines. The pack boasts five different monorail vehicles, from the slow but very large Toyoka Cybria City, to the super-fast but quite high maintenance Stern-Berger Mate.

Feeling nostalgia for the first Cities in Motion? Now you can enjoy the old European style in Cities in Motion 2, too! The European Metropolis set features 34 new buildings to give your dynamic cities the feel of classical Europe.

How are you? I'm Annie Martins, a hotel entrepreneur. Tourism is an important part of the economy of our city. Make sure that all our citizens are well connected, and the city grows and stays interesting for our tourists.
Thank you! Tourism here is a great success. Keep up the good work!
Hello, I'd like to ask a bit of a favor. My friends and I thought we might do a little sightseeing. We would really love to have new tourist lines. I'm sure that would make you a ton of money!
Great, the tourists really love your company!
A fine city you have here! Listen, I'm visiting here for a while and I'd love to go shopping, but I can't find a line that will take me where I was planning to go. Maybe you could build one?
Wow, quick work! That's really impressive! I'll check it out as soon as I can!
Nice to meet you. I'm Ellie, from the tourist bureau. We've been receiving feedback that the public transportation vehicles are not modern enough. Maybe we should buy new ones!
Thanks! Now the city is an even nicer place to travel!
Hello, my name is Jonas. I really love busses! There is no better way to travel to work. How many people you can transport by bus?
Cool, you have some very popular bus lines in the city!
Hi, I'm Lisa and I love trams and metros. It would be wonderful if our city had more of them. Do you think you could build more tram and metro lines?
Excellent, now I don't have to use busses any more!
Hi! Did you know that tourists love water buses? Build a new water bus line!
Nice work, the tourist office is really happy with your company.
Hello. As you may know, tourists bring lots of jobs to the city. Could you connect the tourists with the local companies?
Good work, the tourists love the city!
Hi, have you noticed that competition is fierce in today's economy? Keep up with the competition!
Wow, you really are something! Good luck for the future!

Hello there! I'm Anna and I really love living on the island, but public transportation is not so great around here. I need to visit my mother in the hospital. Could you please connect me to the mainland?
Thank you very much! This really makes my life easier!
Good job! The tourists love the city!

Hi, I'm Jonathan! I've lived my whole life far from the city center, but I'm getting old and I need the city services more and more. But I really don't want to move out of my childhood home! Could you help me and the other elderly? We need good connections!
I never thought you would listen to the old people! Thank you, all my friends are grateful. Now the grandchildren can visit us more often.

Hello there. My name is Sam, and I'm the CEO of the leading grocery company around here. We just opened a new hypermarket and it would be just great if you could make a route for our factory. I hope you can help!
Thank you! Now our employees can use the public transportation!
Good day! I'm Jon and I really don't understand all the excitement about metros. A bus is a cheap option, and you don't have to travel under ground!
Cool, I'm glad you appreciate the buses too.
Hello, I'm Lena! We have almost everything we need around here, but I would really love to visit the theater more often. Could you build a better connection to the theater?
Wow, now my husband will have to take me to the new play!
Jack from your PR department here, hello. Now I don't want to tell you how to do your job, but could you try making our lives a little bit easier by improving the company's reputation? Thanks!
Well done! Our company is looking very good to the outside world!

Hey dude, how's it going? My name's Rick, and I got a hot tip for you: water buses! Everybody loves them and we're not short on water around here. Also, there aren't enough trams in the city. I suggest you get to work and build some new lines!
Sweet dude, now you see my idea was excellent!
Hey there! Keep your city connected! The people are being forced to use their own cars!
Nice work! The public transportation improves the traffic conditions, and it's cheaper for our citizens than driving.
Hello, I came to check how you are doing! Show me how your company is working!
Cool! Your company is working like a charm!
Hi! I'm Helen, a gym teacher. I would really love to take my students swimming, but the swimming hall is too far to walk. Could you help us?
Thank you! Everybody is so excited to go swimming!
Hey! You there! Listen up, young man... I want to get to my favorite shop since they have the cheapest potatoes in town. How about you put a line there!
It's about time! I do hope the potatoes are still on sale!
I have to admit that you young people can get things done. We pensioners are grateful!

Good day to you! I'm Olof Jung, the mayor of the city. We are so glad to have you here! Our city is a business and financial center, but we cannot keep up with the competition without a public transport system. Indeed, our citizens have been clamoring for it! For me, the most important thing is to keep the citizens happy. You may get to work immediately!
Excellent work, our business is growing! Let's see what else we can achieve together.

Hello, my name is Franz and I'm the CEO of the leading telecommunications company in these parts. We've just opened a new office and it would be great if you could add a route that connects it to my home. Any form of transport would be fine. I do hope you can help!
Thank you! Now I can leave my car at home.
Hello, my name is Sandra and I work at the museum. We have a new exhibit and we hope to get a lot of visitors. Please try to transport 50 tourists to the museum.
Excellent! The visitors really loved the exhibit!
Hello! I work in a factory and I would love to have a line connecting my home to the workplace. I hope you can help me!
Thank you! The new line is working so well!
Hey you! It's the PR department again... We would really appreciate if you could raise the company reputation.
Thank you! You really made our day!
Hi! I'm performing a study of the city's public transportation. I need to interview 500 customers! I just need you to transport them.
Thanks, I'll let your PR department know the results!
Hey! I'm Joe from your financial department. We really need to save some money!
Good job, now we are in balance again!
Good day! Have you noticed the city areas along the coast of the river? Connect them!
Good job! The route is now much shorter compared to the roads.
Hi! I need a line which connects my home, workplace, and the grocery store. Visiting the shop after work will be so much easier if you could build a line!
Thank you! This really helps a lot!
Hi, how are you? Show the investors that your company is doing well!
Nice work, the investors are really convinced!
Marvelous job! Our city is growing!
Hello there! Business has been growing and the companies need more workers in all fields. The employers need your help!
Thank you so much for helping out! We will take good care of the company you set up, and send you the profit it makes every month.
Show us what you've got! Transport the workers!
Good job! I'm excited to see what else you can do for the city.
I've heard some unkind rumors about your company! You should do something about your reputation!
That's better! Now my friends are recommending all your services.
Good day! You have too few vehicles! Buy new ones!
Great! Now the customers are much happier.
Hi there! I need new workers for the shopping center. Could you build a line from the housing area so my workers can get here easier?
Thank you! Now I've received plenty of new job applications!
Hello, I'm Susan and I have to take my kids to school every morning. Could you build a tram line to the school?
Excellent, this really has made my mornings easier!
I really think the metro is the most efficient form of public transportation. You should consider building a new metro line!
See? The people just love it.
Hello! Have you completely forgotten me and other pensioners? Build lines for us!
About time that you do something for us!
I think your trams are getting old. You really should buy new ones!
Cool, now I'm excited to travel again.
The office buildings need better connections. You should make sure that the white collar workers are happy with your services!
Good job! The city's economy is doing well!
Awesome work! The city is really full of workers now!

Good day! I'm Alexandr and I work as a traffic engineer. Our city is over 1000 years old and boasts a long history of public transportation. We have one of the highest public transportation rates of any city, but our transportation infrastructure is growing out-dated. Help keep us modern -- and keep the citizens moving!
Marvelous work! Our public transportation is doing better than ever!
I love trolley buses! Our city should have more of them. Could you do something about that?
Wow, I always prefer the trolley bus over other vehicles, when I have the choice!
Culture is important! Make sure that the citizens have a chance to enjoy the museum!
Nice, I bet people are happy with the new line.
Remember the outskirts! Try building couple of lines out past the main city lines!
Good job! The people are happy!
There still isn't a line between my home and workplace. I work at the nuclear plant. Could you build the line? I prefer the trolley buses, by the way.
Thank you! Now I won't have to move.
Hello, how are you doing? I'm Bohdan, the chef of the restaurant. Could you build a trolley line to the restaurant? I'm sure it would bring in a lot of new customers.
Thank you very much! All the tables are reserved and the restaurant is busy!
Hi, I'm Anna and I would love to enjoy sightseeing in the city. Could you build a line that would take me to the art gallery, museum, and park?
Thank you! Now I can really enjoy my holiday.
There's no growing economy without good education! Make sure the students are well connected!
Good job! The students are using your services.
The growing economy needs more workers!

Hello! We really need to be able to move products from our manufacturing plant to several locations -- all at a constant rate. Your trolley buses would be ideal. I hope you can build new trolley lines for us!
Thank you very much! Our factory is more efficient now.
Good job! The economy is growing!
Hello, how are you, my friend? I'm Ctibor Bosko, the mayor of the city. Our city's economic structure has shifted from the industrial to the service-oriented. Keep your company growing!
Good work, you company is growing! These are the kinds of companies our economy needs!
Good transportation is all about the vehicles. You should consider the new vehicles!
Good choices! Remember to maintain them well.
Every company needs good PR to succeed. You should try it out too!
Well done! Your customers are interested in your services.
Hello, I'm Sandra. I would love to visit my grandparents! Could you help me by building a line between our houses?
Thank you! My grandparents were extremely happy!
Nice job! The city looks modern!

Hey! I'm Tomas and I think the city doesn't have enough trolleys. You should build a line connecting the office with another office! Also, you should build a trolley bus line between the church and housing areas. And if it isn't too much to ask, could you build a line between coffee shop and the art gallery?
Amazing, I never dared dream that you might make my wish come true! I'll recommend your company to all my friends!
Hi! I would love to go to the movie theater after school, but there's not a good line for that. Could you do something about it?
Thanks, now I can go to the movies more often.
Hello, how are you doing? I think there aren't enough metro lines in the city. Build one from the museum!
Marvelous job! I'll be using that line every day!
Public transportation is doing better, but there are still areas without connections. Build five new lines to connect the areas!
Cool! Soon, people will have no need for cars!
How fast you can transport 1000 citizens? Show me!
Good work! You have an excellent company!
Thank you for the help! The city is busy and modern!
